website_summaries.verdict: D-Link's good-looking AC3150 Ultra Wi-Fi Router (DIR-885L/R) offers fast throughput performance, MU-MIMO data streaming, and support for open-source firmware, making it our top pick for midrange routers.
pros: Multi-User Multiple Input, Multiple Output (MU-MIMO) capable

website_summaries.verdict: The D-Link AC3200 Ultra Wi-Fi Router (DIR-890L/R) is a massive tri-band router that delivers incredible throughput speeds and looks good doing it.

customer_reviews.title: Limited for advanced use.  Annoying timeout feature.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this router for almost 4 years now but, although it has served its purpose, it is inferior to other routers in the market. For one, it is very limited if you’re an advanced user. For example, it is not capable of crating static routes for LAN based segments. One annoying feature is the timeout when administering the router. It is about 60-seconds long and will LOG YOU OFF unless you click some link. It also has limitation on the number of DHCP reservations you can make as well as port reservation. If you are an advanced user, rethink your purchase and look at linksys or Asus routers.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Excellent WiFi Range and Performance - DD-WRT Compatible.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this router to replace my 880L which was moved to my wife's office. While the 880L was solid, I still had some WIFI dead zones in the house which I mitigated with range extenders. I installed this router and the dead zones disappeared. The D-Link software is fine for basic configuration and suitable for most people, but I'm a power user and I need more control so I installed DD-WRT which has worked without issue since the last beta build in March 2017. Prior to that beta, DD-WRT would have an issue with DHCP renewals from my ISP.
customer_reviews.author: The Slayer

customer_reviews.title: Please dont buy this
customer_reviews.text: Ill be getting my 4th because these quit breaking. Dlink sent one that didnt work at all but regardless im responsible for shipping every time.I got this years ago and got a week where it worked right. 1 week then it broke again. This is one of the worst purchases ive ever made. Lots of customer service loads of stress. I get 65 mbps on hard line, out of the box this gave me about 5 before hours of support. Bottom line it looks cool but its a terribly made product. Ill never buy anything from dlink. The impression from this or the extra shipping I had to pay left me rallying against dlink.
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good for family home.
customer_reviews.text: I have a big family home so at any giving time I could have 12 to 15 devices on the wifi. No other router could keep up but this one did. I did have a little trouble at first with the set up I found out that my anti virus program was kicking it off. Once I got that figured out its all good. I did have to put it up extremely high almost to the roof for it to reach around my whole house.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Morgan

customer_reviews.title: A year later its not good. EDIT: customer service helped me fix the issue
customer_reviews.text: Had it for a year now. Started out wonderful now, a year later, after a firmware update it drops signals constantly and provides very inconsistent coverage. Ive rebooted back to factory settings and still no change. This replaced a tired Asus router that functioned as well as it could for 5 years. EDIT: after posting this review i was contacted by Customer Service. they emailed me instructions on how to fix this issue. so far, a couple weeks later everything is working fine, i have experienced any drops but my kids say they have (not sure i believe them though)
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey C. Ruggieri

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommended  for gaming and heavy traffic
customer_reviews.text: So far stealth fighter or alien life-form perform flawlessly. I'm using it with 100Mb internet from spectrum and about 19 devices at home, security cameras, 2 4k tv's,I-phones, I-pad PS3, 2 lap tops and 2 PC's, cable boxes. Definitely recommended for gaming and heavy local traffic. No need for frequent reboots or reinstall of any devices for 6 mo.
customer_reviews.author: AZ

customer_reviews.title: I can say this is a great router. I'm running it in manual mode with ...
customer_reviews.text: As a network guy, I can say this is a great router. I'm running it in manual mode with the three differnet SSID's setup, not shared, as that allows me to manually assign the radio I place devcies on. I have all my legacy on the old 2.4. I have my lower end devices, less critical devices, and or slower devices on the 1st 5ghz radio. Last, I have my few high bandwidth, high performance on the third radio. Check out reviews from a REAL review site, (not CNET or some other site like that). A site that does technical reviews, hardware testing, compares vs the same capability products, etc. For example:
customer_reviews.author: Eric G

customer_reviews.title: Turn it on and its great at first, then you find it keeps dropping the internet connection. No solution.
customer_reviews.text: Guess I should have read the online reviews and service first. Unfortunately I waited too long to install the router, so I can't return it. Router is nice when you set it up, fast, easy setup. Problems start after the installation. The router keeps dropping its internet access. All lights on the front panel say its working fine, you can sign on to it but it will not connect your computer to the internet even thought the panel light says its connected. Only way to get it to work is to reset it by a power-down reboot. I looked on the internet and saw many complaints, most used remedy is to return it and buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence Zavecz

customer_reviews.title: Had a ridiculous amount of wifi drops until I installed custom firmware. No longer supported.
customer_reviews.text: I would not expect on a $300 router to have to install open source firmware just to have stable wifi...but here we are. I was experiencing all wireless devices being unable to connect every 4-6 hours or so until I installed DD-WRT. After a very frustrating evening I 'fixed' the absurdly expensive router that should work as is. D-Link has stopped supporting this model as well, there will be no future firmware releases coming. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Jean-Luc

customer_reviews.title: Total Success!
customer_reviews.text: The D-Link AC3200 has solved all my connection / signal problems. I was looking for a router with a signal that would take paint off the walls of our house. No paint missing yet, but no more sad signals either! It is a little bigger than I expected, but I don't care! I would give it its own room if it asked. Possible negative: It looks like a dang spaceship. Possible positive: It looks like a dang spaceship. I love it! I also purchased the D-Link AC1200 Range Extender, which works perfectly with this router. Now I have good strong signals everywhere in the house for the first time ever.
customer_reviews.author: M. Simons

customer_reviews.title: The product sucks and their customer service is worse
customer_reviews.text: The product sucks and their customer service is worse. Very unhelpful and tech support made the situation worse. I had to fix the screwup before I could go back to the original problem of being kicked off Wi-Fi continuously. Supports option was to return the unit so they can look at it leaving me with nothing to use. Cutting my losses at this point and purchasing something else since I'm after my return date. Completely dissatisfied all around!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Meh, wouldn't buy D-Link again.
customer_reviews.text: It worked pretty well for about a year and a half. I would have bought something else if I'd have known that they never had any intention of maintaining the firmware. I upgraded to their new firmware, 1.10, which broke the router. I called their support, and they told me to go back to 1.9. When I did that, and the router was still broken (something I found online is very common) their support told me to call a number which basically said to insert my credit card number for paid support. This will be my first and last D-Link router. A year and a half for such an expensive router isn't long enough.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: End of Service Line Agreement
customer_reviews.text: I went to go check on firmware and i see that this product has an EoS agreement effective 1/1/2020. I only bought this in 2017 and paid $$$$ only to have to replace it. not buying from D-link product line ever again!
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn C. A.

customer_reviews.title: I had trouble with this router from day one. ...
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble with this router from day one. My wireless devices could not connect. Through troubleshooting it I found that after rebooting the router the wireless devices would then connect. After the first day I started having issues with the Wi-Fi again; when I left home and then returned the wireless devices I had with me could no longer connect until I rebooted the router. I contacted tech support and they had me disable SmartConnect, this worked sometimes but it defeated the whole reason for buying this model. Since I could not find a permanent solution I returned it to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Works great, dd-wrt is stripped down but that won't matter at all for most people.
customer_reviews.text: Signal quality and range is amazing. My only complaint is that I am used to the full DD-WRT firmware, and while this is DD-WRT it's heavily customized and it's missing about 80% of the base functionality. This will matter if you're computer nerd and want to tinker. For most people who just want a killer router out of the box and use options like device priority and multiple bands it's going to be more than enough and you'll be super happy with it. Also, seriously it's the coolest looking router I've ever seen.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great Router But So So Software to Control It.
customer_reviews.text: This router has incredible WiFi speed and dependability. I stream HD video through it to 3 separate sources with no lag or delay.I have had some minor networking issues with it and the software to control it is not exactly state of the art. It does however have a nice cell phone app to monitor your network from anywhere. Performance wise it's 5 stars for sure but one off because of the lame software.
customer_reviews.author: 1HonestMan

customer_reviews.title: Drops connection with iPhones then won't even let you log back on.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work well with iPhones. I tried two units. Drops connection where signal isn't super strong, then asks for password to login. After a couple of drops unit will not even allow you to log back in. Latest firmware installed. Too bad when close to unit the signal & throughput were strong. D-Link was dropping the connection where 6 year old Apple Airport Extreme was holding the connection. Just got Airport Extreme a/c = no dropping of iPhones at all.
customer_reviews.author: zenart

customer_reviews.title: Great success.
customer_reviews.text: I was having problems with devices dropping off the internet and took a risk that the problem was because of my old/cheap routers (2). This solved all my problems. I have 5 tv's on roku sticks and 15 or so other things connected, 25 or so mbps WOW (cable) internet and had 2 2.4ghz routers and several dead spots in the house (roughly 40x40 with two floors) and into the yard. This hits every corner and no drops (so far). I haven't played with the parental settings yet - they seem not as well documented, but that will be my next task.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Burrows

customer_reviews.title: Best and strongest signal wireless router I've ever had!!!
customer_reviews.text: Best wireless router I've ever owned!!! Long range and strong signal. I have 3 smart TV's, one laptop, one wireless desktop and one hard wired desktop. I also have Netflix and the TV's are located on the main floor and the basement entertainment room. The router is located on the far side of the second floor. So this thing has to send a signal through several walls and it gives me 4 or 5 bars on the farthest TV. I would recommend this product to anybody and I have.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Weaker than my buggy AMP unit.
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I'm surprised that this works so poorly; I have been busy and only just go around to installing it this past weekend. I was replacing an AMP wireless unit that has a buggy web interface (requires a reboot after a use or 2) that was about a 3rd of the price of this unit. While the signal strength is similar using ##INSIDER, the reliability and quality of signal perceived by my systems is lower. Streaming is hit and miss which is the primary reason I bought this. I'm tempted to put my 4 year old AMP unit back and call it a day.
customer_reviews.author: LA Amazoner

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Router for Cord Cutters
customer_reviews.text: At first this drone looking thing had me wondering what the heck my wife bought. My fears were quickly assuaged when I noticed how fast my internet was going and how strong the connectivity was. This device allows me to stream TV content seamlessly and really enjoy jumping on the "cord cutter" band wagon. Although it is a bit large, its totally worth having around if you want solid, stable internet connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Bad with Android phones,
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this router given the amount of money I spent. It does in fact have some very slick software, which is rare with routers. After the April/2015 firmware upgrade a bunch of problems were fixed which show D-Link is paying attention. The big problem I have is that my house full of Android phones have HUGE delays getting anything through this thing. My 4G is much faster. I have searched the forums and tried to find the problem but I have given up for now. So I decided to shelf this thing for awhile (until the next firmware update) and bought a cheap router to get me by. So I'm still hoping.
customer_reviews.author: sHoCkErRoCkEt

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a year then completely bombed on us
customer_reviews.text: We've been battling VERY SLOW internet speeds for over a year thinking there is no way it would be our $270 router causing the issue. Well, just had a tech confirm that indeed our router is not working properly. We get 4 mbps up and 3 down going through the router and hardwired into the modem is 113 mbps. Of course we are out of warranty so off I go to Best Buy to purchase a Nighthawk. We will never buy a Dlink again.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle ONeal

customer_reviews.title: Wired connections are fine, but wifi drops like crazy!
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy. Wired connections work fine, but wifi drops constantly on my devices (Android and iPhones, PC and Mac laptops) anywhere beyond around 15 feet from the router. Returning this and getting another router. Speeds were great when it did work but not worth the constant drops in wifi for seemingly no reason (signal strength was fine, no congestion from other nearby networks). No way to configure separate 2.4 GHz and 5 GHz networks in the configuration either.
customer_reviews.author: Narso

customer_reviews.title: Okay router!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I checked carefully before buying this router, the Netgear that preceded it was a disappointment, especially if you try to get support. This DLink is very intuitive and with 42 wifi devices connected, speeds and responsiveness have been great! It is a little bigger, in physical size than I thought it would be! Update: Discovered some short comings: The attached devices page doesn't always apply the names and reserve IP address that you input, very annoying. DD-WRT flashing leaves a lot to be desired, especially for documentation. Not sure I'd spend this kind of money on a router again.
customer_reviews.author: Chief

customer_reviews.title: Love it but it's huge.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good thing I like art. This thing is huge. It didn't fit in our tv stand so my husband hung it on the wall. Yes, on the wall. Next to the mantle of the fireplace. Where everyone that comes into our home can see it. Luckily, most of them have believed that it was a piece of modern art. It does work absolutely amazing. The WiFi signal in our house was terrible with our last one. My laptop would drop signal in the middle of taking tests for my online classes. We don't have cable so everything is streamed through Amazon fire sticks or tvs. Now everything works great.
customer_reviews.author: ash

customer_reviews.title: It did not do as good of a job as the old wireless N that ...
customer_reviews.text: Did not work. I was having router problems. I first purchased this D-Link AC3200 Ultra Tri-Band Wi-Fi Router (DIR-890L/R). It would not cover my entire house. It did not do as good of a job as the old wireless N that I was replacing. Next I purchased the NETGEAR Nighthawk X6 AC3200 Tri-Band Wi-Fi Router (R8000). It would not cover the entire house either. Both were a pain to set up. So I decided to purchase the Apple Time Capsule 3TB ME182LL/A. Set up was very simple and it covers the entire house. I set it up using a app. on my iPad. I would purchase an Apple Extreme next, but I don't need it.
customer_reviews.author: James Moore

customer_reviews.title: The D-Link Ultra Tri-band works great for this puepose
customer_reviews.text: I bought this D-Link tri band router because we had different components that we needed to connect at different speeds. The D-Link Ultra Tri-band works great for this puepose. There are three different frequencies/bands that can be utilized. One for doorbells and security cameras, one for TV connections and one for guests? We've had the D-Link for a while now and no real problems.
customer_reviews.author: rkanatzar

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service rocks.
customer_reviews.text: Customer service is as important a consideration as which product to buy. I recently had to contact D Link support and spoke with Agent ID AR004620 in reference to an issue I'd been having with download speeds. Tech call ref # C6768088. Not only was the agent polite, patient and knowledgeable he went over and above to ensure my satisfaction with this gorgeous router. I am actually now pulling speeds over what my internet provider says are possible. Yahoo and woo-hoo. Not only is this router the bomb, so is the customer service staff D Link has. I would recommend this router to anyone looking for a top of the line router and customer service to back it up.
customer_reviews.author: SRP

customer_reviews.title: As good as what I'd hoped it would be EXCEPT
customer_reviews.text: Great features in the firewall. Signal strength no longer an issue as was with my old D-Link. There are some simple things I'd like to have easy access to but can't figure out. For instance, when using the set up guide, I created a guest account and I'd like to delete it but can't figure out how. Nor can I figure out how to change the name of the router that's shown for potential networks to connect to. Modified my rating from 5 to 4 because they've removed MAC filtering. Odd decision.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Setup was easy but the big problem is that the UI doesn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy but the big problem is that the UI doesn't have very many advanced options to disable some of the core features like QoS. Right now if I try to bittorrent anything (say a Linux ISO or a large data set (I'm a data scientist)) then I take down the ENTIRE network... For a $300 high end router this is kind or ridiculous... I might return it as it's just defective IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin A. Burton

customer_reviews.title: But overall I am happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my 5-year-old wifi router with this one and experienced a significant gain in wifi coverage, so much so that I unplugged my repeater. I am very impressed with the performance. For me there are two design drawbacks. One, the thing is huge. I call it the "red beast." Two, I mount my router on the wall and the way this one mounts the cables enter from the top. This makes for a bunch of cables coming up, over and around the thing to plug in on the top, including the power. For me, coming in the bottom would be much cleaner. But overall I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R. Vomund

customer_reviews.title: looks cool. works poorly.
customer_reviews.text: user interface is a farce. poor controls. no ip reservations without the external device (like a phone, computer, camera, etc) on and connected...and oh, by the way, cannot be removed from the router if the device fails. too few reservations if and when the router is connected. i have better control and capabilities on my several year old apple airport extremes and express. for a lot less money.
customer_reviews.author: Lazlo

customer_reviews.title: Super fast router
customer_reviews.text: Tripled to quadrupled my speed depending on distance from the router even with suboptimal placement (next to a bunch of other electronics). I upgraded from a 4 year old Linksys AC1600 and changed my cable modem from the Arris SB6141 to SB6183 to reduce bottleneck. Now I'm getting 200 Mbps 15 ft within the same room and 75 Mbps in an adjacent room, through a wall and roughly 35 ft away. 1 story above, 2 rooms away, I'm getting 30 Mbps. These speeds are on the 802.11N standard. The router looks nice next to my receiver and TV also. No reliability issues within this first week of use.
customer_reviews.author: M. Do

customer_reviews.title: Look at Netgear
customer_reviews.text: I bought this during Prime Day for a good price. Had recently upgraded to Shield TV and the reported compatibility was a selling point. We were coming off of a Netgear router. Overall, the Netgear router and online interface are much more reliable and easier to use. Wifi connections on cell phones, Chromebook and Harmony hub are often difficult or constantly dropping, even after changing settings. Plus the thing is huge. If you have a way to hang in on the wall it will help save some space. Will likely go back to Netgear when this dies or becomes obsolete.
customer_reviews.author: M. Heydt

customer_reviews.title: Blazing fast 802.11ac Wi-Fi router
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for an inexpensive home Wi-Fi router, this isn't the one for you. But if you want a solid, excellent performance Wi-Fi router that provides the blazing fast speed of the 802.11ac network, then this is a great choice. It was fairly easy to set up using the wizard that launches when you connect to it, the instruction manual was decent, you can manually change some settings fairly easily after it's all set up without using the wizard, and so far it's providing excellent coverage in all the areas of our house with blazing fast Wi-Fi speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Bergman

customer_reviews.title: Works in my old house!
customer_reviews.text: I have struggled for years trying to get the wireless signal all over my home - 85 years old (lathe & plaster plus old, dense wood). And of course, there is the need for the many more devices devices that I now use. This router did the trick, plus has the added capability of prioritizing my devices. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: 4DSC

customer_reviews.title: Buggy firmware, but great when it works
customer_reviews.text: Great reception when it works, which is most of the time. Firmware seems buggy as unit will sometimes lose connections (devices will see the wifi but can't connect until the router is power cycled) or settings will get lost. Seems like the more features you enable the less reliable the unit is, so I'd recommend keeping it basic (not turning on QoS or Shareport or myDlink) unless you absolutely need the features. D-Link does seem to update the firmware fairly often so hopefully issues will be resolved soon. If it worked 100% reliably, would be a 5-star review.
customer_reviews.author: J. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: It's pretty huge but still not too huge to be considered ...
customer_reviews.text: The images on the site didn't do this router justice. It's pretty huge but still not too huge to be considered a space tortoise. The features are easy to use and navigation is a breeze through the UI. I haven't had any issues so far beyond coverage but that's probably relating to where I located the router and not the router itself. I read about devices dropping off the Wi-Fi but I haven't experienced that. As for the coverage itself I simply dropped in an extender and now it covers the entire house with no trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Now unfortunately it doesn't work at all and good luck with D-link customer service if you do have ...
customer_reviews.text: This product is absolute junk. It worked for about 3 months and then stopped functioning. Multiple emails and calls to d-link yielded zero help. Their last effort directed us to a phone number where unless you speak Chinese you are out of luck. This router does not seem to be fully compatible with apple devices. We had issues with Apple devices locking up repeatedly even when the router did function. Now unfortunately it doesn't work at all and good luck with D-link customer service if you do have problems, they clearly don't stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: K N Easter

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 2 months!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this product about 2 months ago and it worked perfectly the first month. All we run off of the router is a computer and WiFi for cell phone use. After that it started slowing down. The product has completely stopped working now. We called our internet provider and isolated the issue to the router we bought. We also bought a 3 year insurance protection plan with the router, but when we called D-Link, they would not help us to fix, replace, or refund the product even though we have a THREE YEAR insurance protection plan. Do not buy this product. It will not work.
customer_reviews.author: M. Leone

customer_reviews.title: ... to say for the price it should be much better. My last router which was an inexpensive netgear ...
customer_reviews.text: I have to say for the price it should be much better. My last router which was an inexpensive netgear gave superior signal strength. With this router 30 feet away is the max I can get out of it. Forget going outside. I would highly recommend not purchasing this router unless you like the design, which is its finest feature. Stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My husband bought this cz we doont get good signal in our house
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this cz we doont get good signal in our house. He thought because it is so expensive it would fix our problems. This no joke made our wifi worse than it was when we had a wal-mart router. I now don't get signal in my living room in addition to the bedroom, whereas before our problem was we didn't get signal in the bedroom only.....thanks super expensive router.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This 3200 is well worth the money...
customer_reviews.text: I added this 3200 to my current router to boost the wireless signal, and increase my security. I found it easy to install and sync within my wireless system. I highly recommend this unit. It's worth the money to increase the speed of my wireless signal. I no longer find my streaming buffering and internet websites loading quicker.
customer_reviews.author: DW Prime Tunes

customer_reviews.title: I placed it in our great room, with as few walls as possible between ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this primarily as an access point, and not a router, but the range on it is superb and covers my entire home, and even sufficiently outside so that I can stream music while doing yard work. I placed it in our great room, with as few walls as possible between rooms, so I'm sure that's contributing to its range. Overall, however, the performance has been very good for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Chad B.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and excellent range
customer_reviews.text: This modem works excellent. Have had the occasional reboot required because we have over 25 devices on the home network. Was a breeze to set up and has been operating flawlessly ever since. Not a techie, but this modem passes through the high bandwidth connection consistently and reliably. No problems getting a connection anywhere in the house and about 10-20 feet outside the house. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kapur

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Range is no better than other routers I've had - Even models without six antennae. Continuity is worse than average. I'm frequently losing connection and reconnecting... Documentation in box is pretty much just a quick start. Need to download anything technical. I expected more for the price. The poorly documented rules capability is ok. I've been able to set rules that kick the kids off at a reasonable time on school nights. For the price, design, and great packaging, I expected better performance.
customer_reviews.author: Noel S. Halvorsen

customer_reviews.title: Good, but drops connections.
customer_reviews.text: This router is pretty good overall. The smart connect feature seems to work well. My one overall complaint is that the router drops the connection to my iDevices (iPhone, iPad). I say that this router drops the wireless connection since other routers I have used in the past have not had this issue. There have been no firmware updates so not sure of how to correct these issues.
customer_reviews.author: C. T. Bower

customer_reviews.title: after d link setup the unit with their optimum settings the problem continued and actually got worse. i don't recommend this rou
customer_reviews.text: since day one this unit has done everything from cutting off reboot on his home and many blackouts during working hrs. i called d-link to get a replacement unit and they insisted that even thought the unit constantly reboots is a setting problem. after d link setup the unit with their optimum settings the problem continued and actually got worse. i don't recommend this router once big let down.
customer_reviews.author: manuel martinez

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I live in a 1400 sqft apartment with a child and another adult. Between the four of us, we have about 20 internet enabled devices fighting for IPs at any given moment. Even with reserved IPs, the old router would struggle and drop connections frequently. Since setting up the new network in December, I haven't had a single router related issue or complaint from someone who can't connect to the internet. Pros: FAST. Tri Band. Easy Setup. Reliable. Cons: Limited advanced settings. HUGE (I half expect it to fly off and become the chest plate for a giant anime robot)
customer_reviews.author: P. Akundi

customer_reviews.title: Problems from time to time
customer_reviews.text: From time to time it tends to disconnect itself and I need to set everything again; however when it works it works pretty well. So no sure whether I recommend it or not.
customer_reviews.author: G. Baigorria

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining.
customer_reviews.text: This is big and looks like some sort of invading alien thing which is why I hung it from the wall where people come in my office. It gets about half of them. Hahahah. But I digress. It did boost the signal over the entire house over my old router and it works great. I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Stout

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a 2 bdr townhouse and have been having serious issues getting signal upstairs. I admit this one is a bit more then what I needed, however it does the job masterfully. Only one issue I have run into... the smart select on the bands has cost me a few attacks in clash of clans. It drops your net for a second and reconnects immediately thereafter. So any game that is terribly temperamental like CoC may experience some minor issues. That having been my ONLY issue, it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: UPDATING MY REVIEW Its been two years and so so on the router.. I bought 2 of them in Oct 2015 and yesterday one of them will no longer send out a signal and a week before the same thing happened. Called tech support but for the fee to chat about the issue on a out of warranty router. Sad to spend that much money on two and they all happen to go out at the same time at different homes.
customer_reviews.author: robert

customer_reviews.title: Shop more before you purchase
customer_reviews.text: Thought this was the best. Paid over $500. I have had nothing but problems with the product. Updates dropping signal. Etc. didn’t increase bandwidth nor upload / download speeds. Went to net gear and velops post this exp naive thing
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Graham

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy
customer_reviews.text: This product failed within 10 months after buying it. First off, let me say that my husband and I are very tech savy and after spending 2 hours with tech support, we have declared the router dead. I'm very disapointed in this product and I do not recommend it at all. Since we do not allow ourselves to be burned twice, we will be going to another competitor.
customer_reviews.author: Molly B.

customer_reviews.title: Great combined with ARRIS SB6190
customer_reviews.text: I had been wanting to get better control of my WiFi and had already changed to a personal Modem ARRIS SB6190 with TWC. This router was easy to setup and configure with the controls that I wanted. The difference between the TWC Modem/Router and this new setup is amazing. While the speed inbound from TWC went up about 8% the stability of my home network is really great. Adding QOS to my TV and XBOX One for streaming and gaming but putting the highest priority on my home office PC worked really well.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Bergo

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Crap, junk, trash, no device can stay connected for more than a few minutes. Start my computer, can not connect without a restart of the router. Same with all computers, telephones, iPads, this router sucks! And I found out too late to return it! Replaced it with links's wrt3200 acm, no more problems.
customer_reviews.author: chuck michaels

customer_reviews.title: Best router I ever owned.  BEST RANGE!
customer_reviews.text: Super wireless router! Everything as advertised and plus more. GREAT RANGE!!!, Easy setup. Reaches every part of a 5000 sq ft house including the basement and the router is on the 2nd floor.
customer_reviews.author: S W

customer_reviews.title: Can't Go Wrong
customer_reviews.text: I was not happy when I first received my router. It seem slow and was dropping the internet repeatedly. Upgraded the firmware and works fantastic. Very easy to upgrade and install. Range is much better than my old router, however the old router was a inexpensive unit. I now can go to my garage which is not attached to my house and about 75 feet from the router and the Wi-Fi works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kelvin Bass

customer_reviews.title: Works for a few months, now drops wifi all the time, their support is clueless
customer_reviews.text: For the first few months, this world great. Very fast, no connection problems. Then the problems started. The wifi is stable, but devices connected to the router will not connect to the internet. The router shows internet available, but none of the devices connects. Reset router, It will work again for a few hours to a a few days. Then same issue again. Their support is clueless and useless.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Joe

customer_reviews.title: Powerful router with minor issues
customer_reviews.text: Only four stars out of five because of the overheating problem I seem to be having. It is a powerful router, so I'm not sure if my placement is causing this issue or not. Also, having connectivity continuity issues, doesn't seem to want to ALWAYS stay connected to mobile devices. LAN works perfect.
customer_reviews.author: WyomingDad

customer_reviews.title: so good I bought two Great coverage on both of our ...
customer_reviews.text: so good I bought two Great coverage on both of our large houses. Coverage area of 5000+sf. Dumped the unit the cable company gave me and increased the speed from a crappy 20mbs to 60+ One is in the house and the other in the garage and have not had any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph J Tognetti Jr

customer_reviews.title: OMG... it's a beast. Only 4 ...
customer_reviews.text: OMG... it's a beast. Only 4 stars as I've had to reset it a couple times for unknown reasons. No issues other than that... Range is EXTREME. Bandwidth is EXTREME. Hands down, a beast of a machine!
customer_reviews.author: David L.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed. Dlink never ever again.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product. After all the reviews I've read I guessed that would be better, faster and more reliable than the old one I had. I was wrong. Permanent interruptions and cuts. I've updated the firmware many times, reset the unit, changed the channels, tried 2.4 band, 5Ghz band and always same result. The worst thing is that after 6 months I can't return it, so I wasted my money badly. Never again Dlink.
customer_reviews.author: R. Sabella

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Besides looking awesome the router has worked great. Real easy to set if you're a novice and has all the configuration you need for a home network. Originally purchased because I was getting really bad lag and poor consistency on my PS4. Even without configuring the QoS and ports it took care of those issues and helped every other device perform better. While quite pricey I believe it is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: It is big and looks alien. But it is ...
customer_reviews.text: It is big and looks alien. But it is CRAZY fast. I now get 100% throughput from the internet connection to our devices. When I run Speedtest on my iphone, I get 90Mbps, which is what Comcast delivers to the house. The signal is very strong, able to get everywhere in the house. Even the kids noticed how much faster their internet seemed. This replaced an older D-Link DIR-655.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Looks good and performs top notch
customer_reviews.text: Works like a champ! Well maybe, fifa on xbox is still giving me bs calls! Performance 5 stars! I havent resent the router in 6 months and still going strong with no issues
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best looking router ever made thats a must say ok ...
customer_reviews.text: Best looking router ever made thats a must say ok lets get into the bad each time you make a change to this device it takes 72seconds b4 it restarts thats crazy in this day and age the router also kind of lack so features which i would have prefer to have and the range on this thing is not all that made its because i have thick walls but i had to buy a d-link extender that made things worst dwl, My speed fell to the ground. Other wise this is a eye catcher a must have smooth going.
customer_reviews.author: T.O.P.S ENTERPRISE

customer_reviews.title: Avoid These Routers
customer_reviews.text: The routers has been dropping connections consistantly. DLink Technical support says the firmware updates that fix them (2) actually drops the internet connection worse, yet they have been on their site more than 9 months. Load balancing must be turned off since it doesn't work, again per their Technical Support. We feel that these were the PRIMARY reason we purchased these 'high end' routers. We're trying to figure out a way to get a refund or exchange for another product from another manufacturer that works as advertised. D-Link Case Number can be provided.
customer_reviews.author: H. J. Brubaker

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the Nighthawk which started to freak out after ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got this. A snap to get running. Much better than the Nighthawk which started to freak out after only a few months of use. It's just a bit bigger than the Nighthawk but seems like it's made of higher quality materials. I'm streaming HD Apple Tv and running 3 devices and I don't see a break up. Range is better than Nighthawk too. So, so far, I'm pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D

customer_reviews.title: It looked really cool. The lights on the front were hard to ...
customer_reviews.text: It looked really cool. The lights on the front were hard to see since they are at a steep angle. There is only one way to set it if it is on a flat surface. It can be mounted on a wall though. The " SmartConnect" technology seemed confused the whole time I had it up and running. It would randomly drop devices. One device would hook right up and while on another it would take 3 or 4 tries at entering the passphrase. I manually turned the " SmartConnect" off which seemed to help with the apparent confusion. Still, some devices wouldn't connect in a timely manner. I sent it back. Amazon was great to work with though.
customer_reviews.author: MtnBikrTN

customer_reviews.title: Ultimate router for home with 15+ smart/wireless: computers, phones, tablets, cameras, Kindles, iPods, etc, plus teen hangout.
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY, ALL bands in remote corners of house (even northern most room upstairs has full coverage and no dropped wi-fi even on Christmas)--used to have a dot or 1 band. D-link is in back southern most corner of home office too; not centrally located, walls galore, 2 story house. May use old router on dedicated game console on busiest TV. This is a genuine workhorse! Hubby set up with absolutely ZERO issues & arrived 2 days early. Thrilled.
customer_reviews.author: SacoFamily2

customer_reviews.title: One year, one month, DEAD
customer_reviews.text: Well, I'm not sure to be happy about the service while it lasted or to be extremely irritated that the couple of hundred dollars didn't do more. Yes, constant rebooting was no fun. Yes when it worked, it worked fine. Yes, before it died it showed symptoms. Yes they were sporadic and just thought to be just more hateful rebooting. No, it was dead. Well, no more D-Link for me or Netgear for that matter. Maybe I'll keep the case - it at least makes a good impression.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Harris

customer_reviews.title: Spaceship!
customer_reviews.text: So far I love it! I have a 2700+ sqft house with 100mbs down connection. I run a TV, PlayStation (Different than the first TV), two smartphones, and a laptop on it with no problems! I haven't yet configured it yet but out of the box I'm satisfied at how easy it was to set up. It does have a large footprint; my wife and cable guy call it a spaceship. However, it's great so cannot complain!
customer_reviews.author: jcaruso001

customer_reviews.title: Rip off alert, doesnt work, keeps timing out and disconnecting
customer_reviews.text: Not worth it, I feel robbed cause I'm stuck with this POS and I'm not able to get a replacement
customer_reviews.author: Israel Clark

customer_reviews.title: Buy Anything But This Router
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed, has terrible range. Drops devices all the time, it hates Alexa...About the only thing cool is the looks. My old router from 5 years ago actually was better in every way at half the cost, RIP old router you did good wish you would not have died. I wish I could return this POS. Buy something else, anything should be better.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not the perfect router
customer_reviews.text: So far our opinions of this product are mixed. When it works, it gives a strong signal. One issue is that it blinks off regularly for a few seconds to a few minutes. No reason, the connection from our provider is good, just router roulette. Second issue is that it has one 2.5 band and 2 5.0 bands. Many of our devices, though only a year old, won't connect to the 5.0 bands. Thus we have a cluster of devices all trying to use the 2.5 band and slowing it down. It also made it impossible for us to split the bands into 3 servers to password control access for our teen users.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen Perling

customer_reviews.title: At first this seemed like a great router
customer_reviews.text: At first this seemed like a great router. After only a day of usage the router restarts itself randomly throughout the day. It seems like it over heats and then it just shuts off and restarts. This is an embarrassment for a router that costs $300 and it's the year 2015. I highly regret purchasing this product since this thing restarts itself at least 3 times a day. 1 Star. EDIT: I've upgraded to the latest firmware as directed by support and it still restarts randomly. If i could give this 0 stars I would. So much money spent for a router that has so many problems.
customer_reviews.author: AZ

customer_reviews.title: Wireless network is now in Beast mode
customer_reviews.text: Talking about taking your wireless network into beast mode. It was fast and easy to setup and I replaced an older Linksys EA6900. I love the auto frequency selection. Some devices go to 5 GHz others to 2.4 GHz. No more having to manually select. I am not using it as my router, only as an AP. Speedtest.net showed full down and up load speeds. Happy so far. May get another one for my other house.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Hardware upgrade -- software downgrade.
customer_reviews.text: Good range, but limited user control compared to earlier d-link routers. Very poor/spotty reporting of currently connected devices -- a real pain if you want/need to create DHCP reserves. I really expected better hardware than earlier devices (and that I got), along with software at least as good as earlier devices (and that I did NOT get).
customer_reviews.author: HughDaMan

customer_reviews.title: and the manual recommended tilting the antennae at a 45° angle which actually ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed with this product so far. I can run 2 XBO's, an amazon fire tv, a roku, and 4 smartphones all at once without any lag, buffering , etc. My only complaints are that i could not register the device since i don't believe it came with the proper login information (didn't effect my ability to connect to the internet though), and the manual recommended tilting the antennae at a 45° angle which actually weakened the connection rather than improved it.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Love it dont know how i lived my life this long without it
customer_reviews.text: Still use this bad boy. People think I have some alien technology in my house. My internet doesn't cut out and signal is good through my house so maybe it is alien technology.
customer_reviews.author: Justicerho

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: This is the first D-link product I purchased and am well satisfied. I spent a good deal of time researching all router systems and this product does everything plus. I would recommend it to anyone whole heartily!!
customer_reviews.author: StrongmanOX

customer_reviews.title: Large, but great signal and multi-channel use.
customer_reviews.text: Great signal. I wondered if I needed to spend the money, but I would do it again. Not quite the support I would expect, especially with the current DLink hacking, but I would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie C. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Drops signal, bad customer service
customer_reviews.text: When it works correctly it's a very fast router. I had to reset this router many times because it had a hard time keeping a quality signal. The ability to speak to their customer service regarding these issues proved to be impossible. So, poor product support. This shouldn't happen with a top router that costs so much.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: AWEOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: I'd been dreaming about this router since MKBHD displayed it AND the almost 500MPS speed he was getting from it, during a set-up tour video he did last year. Works like a charm and looks cool too.
customer_reviews.author: R. Solomon

customer_reviews.title: Great router that is worth the money...
customer_reviews.text: This router has solved the family connectivity issues... My wife has her band and is happy, and there is plenty of speed for the rest of our wireless devices. The D-Link software is the best I have used and works without any hassles. The remote camera just "plug" in with the press of a button. D-Link remote software is solid and it is easy to keep an eye on all the devices and camera anywhere in the world.
customer_reviews.author: D. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Totally thrashed every other Router I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Great Router! Replaced a Meraki commercial grade Access Point in my home. Fully covers my 2000sq ft home with full signal on both floors. Really pushed it with devices streaming in multiple rooms and it didn't miss a beat. Highly recommend this if you want full/ high speed wireless coverage. Yes - its a bit more expensive but I think it is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Ricketts

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I have a large home and have tried 3 different 200 plus dollar routers in the last 2 years because they don't sell Dlink locally. I switched back and I am getting full bars where I got no service and also my speed test has doubled.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch S

customer_reviews.title: Looks cool, but did not increase data transfer speed
customer_reviews.text: Looks cool and was fairly easy to set up. Worth viewing the set up video on the company website. Solved my problem of frequent disconnects from my town cable internet service, but did not noticeably increase upload or download speed. Extended wifi range a bit, but not dramatically. Afraid that the ultimate solution to my slow data speed will be to pay the cable company more per month for a faster connection
customer_reviews.author: F. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great router, but sporadically drops signal.
customer_reviews.text: Great range and speed when it worked. Even my hardwired connections have issues. Not sure if I just go a dud, or if it's a hardware/software issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Lewis

customer_reviews.title: I subscribe to comcast and their combined modem and router was useless. I had dead spots on the far side ...
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on Wi-Fi routers before I bought this one. I subscribe to comcast and their combined modem and router was useless. I had dead spots on the far side of my home on all 3 floors. Since purchasing this box some months back I can say that the wi-fi works just great. My home is 3 floors and about 3000 sq. ft. It covers the entire area and a big portion of the yard. Set up was easy. The administrative interface is good. It has a lot of features. You can prioritize devices on the network so that #1 gets network priority and so on. D-LINK make good products.
customer_reviews.author: Lasttrain2Dagenham

customer_reviews.title: The worst
customer_reviews.text: This router does a worse job of getting the signal out than the crappy one provided to us by our ISP. We cannot get wifi out on the deck approx. 20 feet away from the router and through only one wall. We cannot get it in the basement at all. All places we could get it with the old one that stopped working. Biggest waste of money. I don't usually review products but felt I needed to let people know that this is junk.
customer_reviews.author: nmk

customer_reviews.title: Handles all my traffic with ease
customer_reviews.text: This router was a very easy, almost plug and play set up. It is powerful and solved all the problems I was previously having with distance and bandwidth. This replaced a very old d-Link router that had served me well for many years (yes I said years), but was unable to handle all the traffic I am placing on my system. This AC3200 handles it with ease.
customer_reviews.author: macsog60

customer_reviews.title: Simple setup, great admin features, fastest download speeds
customer_reviews.text: I had a LinkSys AC1900 that was periodically pausing on wifi connections, so I replaced it with this router. Very pleased. Setup was trivial, all of my devices were immediately recognized. The admin screen gives great feedback when the cable burps (yeah, I know. But it's Comcast.). And my download speeds increased from 60Mbps to 70Mbps on average. I couldn't be more pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Scarton

customer_reviews.title: While the speed is better than my providers router the range sucks
customer_reviews.text: While the speed is better than my providers router the range sucks. Also i had a geoup of friends over for a fantasy football draft and it kept kicking people off...it was only 6 guys using the wireless. Not worth the money in my eyes. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: JUSTIN G. THIBODEAU

customer_reviews.title: This device was recommended to me by my cable technician as a solution ...
customer_reviews.text: This device was recommended to me by my cable technician as a solution to our wireless internet problem. I own a 4000 sq ft dance studio. EVERY electronic device is wireless in this studio. This worked! No more complaints. No more issues! Works like a charm!
customer_reviews.author: Toinette Robinson

customer_reviews.title: This router is AMAZING! It looks like an alien bug
customer_reviews.text: This router is AMAZING! It looks like an alien bug, but we love that you can direct the antennas to give a stronger broadcast signal in different locations of the house. We use to have issues with our wireless router at opposite ends of the house, but this router took care of all of problems. Our wireless signal is strong everywhere we go in our house now. LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: Luke & Eileen Bailey

customer_reviews.title: NOT WHAT IT SEEMS
customer_reviews.text: Bought this bases on a web search of best router to buy. I was really impressed with everything that it could do. It ended up being more problems for gaming. I have a wired connection and the router wouldn't work through a Ethernet cord. It would connect wirelessly but wouldn't allow me to play online. I tried for a week to fix it and use all the customer support that I could get. Going with another router Linksys WRT AC1900 Smart Wi-Fi router. I hope I have no problems. I ended up hooking my old router back up. Good ol faithfull!!!
customer_reviews.author: steven alberts

product_meta.title: D-Link AC3200 Ultra Tri-Band Wi-Fi Router With 6 High Performance Beamforming Antennas (DIR-890L/R)
product_meta.description: The AC3200 Ultra Wi-Fi Router (DIR-890L/R) delivers premium performance for today’s most demanding tasks: HD streaming, gaming, and multiple device usage. It comes packed with speeds of up to 3.2Gbps, a dual core processor, three bands (one 2.4GHz and two 5GHz), AC Smart Beam technology, Intelligent Quality of Service (QoS) with traffic prioritization, six high-performance external antennas for maximum range, a New user interface, Smart Connect and with a really easy setup. The perfect combination of performance and ease of use.
feature_bullets: Ultimate Wi-Fi performance with AC3200 Tri Band speeds (1 x 600 Mbps in 2.4GHz + 2 x 1300 Mbps in 5GHz) to support more connected Wi-Fi devices to your high speed home network
Enjoy 4K/HD video and online gaming simultaneously with 3 x 3 data streams and 6 high performance antennas
The 1GHz dual core processor gives you powerful wired and wireless speeds
Advanced smart connect allocates the best possible band for maximal Wi-Fi performance; Wi-Fi coverage large home, Compatibility: Works with existing and future Wi-Fi devices
Advanced AC Smart Beam tracks your connected devices for enhanced Wi-Fi speed and range throughout your home
Intelligent QoS traffic optimization delivers seamless performance for your applications
Intuitive user interface for easy Installation and network management from your mobile devices or desktop
Advanced security features WPA/WPA2 encryption for a safe home network.Box shows the part as DIR 890L and the color designation of red is the /R

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars1,120 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
